bio:treatment.description: Plants usually robust perennials. Blades broad, plicate. Panicles usually loose; bristles solitary, subtending the terminal spikelet of each ultimate branchlet, occasionally present beneath the other spikelets. Spikelets 2.5-5 mm, slender, often acuminate.
bio:treatment.discussion: Setaria subg. Ptychophyllum is primarily an American taxon, but is also found in the Eastern Hemisphere. Three species, all introduced, have been found in the Flora region.
